Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A novel set in the Jazz Age that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A novel about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A classic romance novel that critiques the social norms of 19th-century England.

Title: Moby-Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge against a white whale.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A novel about teenage alienation and the challenges of growing up.

Title: War and Peace
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Description: A historical novel that explores Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Description: A psychological novel about guilt, redemption, and morality.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A dystopian novel envisioning a technologically advanced future society.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A fantasy epic following the journey to destroy the One Ring.

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Author: J.K. Rowling
Description: The first book in the Harry Potter series about a young wizard's adventures.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A fantasy adventure about Bilbo Baggins' journey to reclaim a lost kingdom.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Author: Ray Bradbury
Description: A dystopian novel about a future where books are banned and burned.

Title: The Alchemist
Author: Paulo Coelho
Description: A novel about a shepherd's journey to discover his personal legend.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Author: Dan Brown
Description: A thriller involving secret societies and historical mysteries.

Title: Dracula
Author: Bram Stoker
Description: A gothic horror novel about Count Dracula's attempt to move to England.

Title: Frankenstein
Author: Mary Shelley
Description: A novel about a scientist who creates a living being with unintended consequences.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Author: Oscar Wilde
Description: A novel about vanity and corruption, where a portrait ages instead of its subject.

Title: The Odyssey
Author: Homer
Description: An ancient Greek epic poem about Odysseus' journey home from Troy.

Title: The Iliad
Author: Homer
Description: An ancient Greek epic about the Trojan War.

Title: Les Misérables
Author: Victor Hugo
Description: A novel about justice, redemption, and revolution in 19th-century France.

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Author: Alexandre Dumas
Description: A novel about betrayal, revenge, and justice.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Brontë
Description: A novel about an orphaned girl’s journey to independence and love.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Brontë
Description: A novel about love and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.

Title: Great Expectations
Author: Charles Dickens
Description: A coming-of-age novel about personal growth and societal expectations.

Title: Little Women
Author: Louisa May Alcott
Description: A novel following the lives of four sisters during the Civil War era.

Title: The Scarlet Letter
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
Description: A novel about sin, guilt, and redemption in Puritan New England.

Title: Animal Farm
Author: George Orwell
Description: A satirical novella that allegorizes the Russian Revolution.

Title: The Shining
Author: Stephen King
Description: A horror novel about a haunted hotel and its sinister influence.
